pullRequest.title: Improve JSON parsing
pullRequest.bodyText:
This commit updates the forked version of our JSON parser to use
SourceLocation directly, not need a stack of source locations when
parsing node values because the parser now passes that in when calling
end* methods, and swaps our ParseException with ModelSyntaxException.
This improves the performance of the JSON parser a bit and also removes
code that was duplicative with things in the rest of the project (like
Location vs SourceLocation).
Issue #, if available:
Description of changes:
By submitting this pull request, I confirm that my contribution is made under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license.

commit.message:
Improve JSON parsing

This commit updates the forked version of our JSON parser to use
SourceLocation directly, not need a stack of source locations when
parsing node values because the parser now passes that in when calling
end* methods, and swaps our ParseException with ModelSyntaxException.
This improves the performance of the JSON parser a bit and also removes
code that was duplicative with things in the rest of the project (like
Location vs SourceLocation).

nodes.bodyText: There are a decent amount of commented out lines here that, if uncommented, would route to methods on JsonHandler that no longer exist.
